alert.note: Alert for Branch (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 10:07AM EST until February 22 at 1:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana, southwest Michigan and northwest Ohio, including the following counties, in northern Indiana, Allen IN, De Kalb, Kosciusko, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, Wabash and Whitley. In southwest Michigan, Branch and Hillsdale. In northwest Ohio, Williams. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1006 AM EST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain and snowmelt in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Any lingering light rain and drizzle will change over to snow this afternoon into this evening. - Reports of very high water on roads throughout the area. Several roads have been closed due to the high water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Wayne, Auburn, Coldwater, Kendallville, Columbia City, Angola, Hillsdale, Garrett, Ligonier, Butler, Lagrange, Tri- lakes, Huntertown, Avilla, Bronson, Albion, Hudson, Jonesville, Waterloo and Fremont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
